# <a name="has-symbols-supversion-badge21sup"></a>has-symbols <sup>[![Badge della versione][2]][1]</sup>

[![stato delle dipendenze][5]][6]
[![stato delle dipendenze di sviluppo][7]][8]
[![Licenza][license-image]][license-url]
[![Download][downloads-image]][downloads-url]

[![badge npm][11]][1]

Stabilire se l'ambiente JS offre il supporto per i simboli. Supporta specifiche o sham.

## <a name="example"></a>Esempio

```js
var hasSymbols = require('has-symbols');

hasSymbols() === true; // if the environment has native Symbol support. Not polyfillable, not forgeable.

var hasSymbolsKinda = require('has-symbols/shams');
hasSymbolsKinda() === true; // if the environment has a Symbol sham that mostly follows the spec.
```

## <a name="supported-symbol-shams"></a>Sham dei simboli supportati
 - get-own-property-symbols [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/get-own-property-symbols) | [github](https://github.com/WebReflection/get-own-property-symbols)
 - core-js [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/core-js) | [github](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js)

## <a name="tests"></a>Test
Ãˆ sufficiente clonare il repository, `npm install`, ed eseguire `npm test`
